page.content: {BARNET HORSE FAIR} BARNET HORSE FAIR IS HELD EVERY SEPTEMBER.IN THE LAST FEW YEARS IT HAS BEEN HELD IN A FIELD NEAR TOTTERIDGE BECAUSE THE COUNCIL BARRACADED THE USUAL FIELD OFF BARNET LANE WITH SKIPS. OPPOSITION TO THE HORSE FAIR IS NOT NEW.IN 1888 THE LORD OF THE MANOR PETITIONED THE HOME SECRETARY TO ABOLISH THE FAIR BUT THIS WAS OPPOSED SUCCESSFULLY BY BARNET TOWNSMEN.THEY ARGUED THAT THEY WOULD LOSE FINANCIALLY BECAUSE AT THE TIME CATTLE WERE TRADED AS WELL;ABOUT 50,000 HEAD OF CATTLE WOULD CHANGE HANDS AT THE FAIR.THE SEPTEMBER FAIR WAS FOUNDED BY CHARTER IN HENRY THE SECOND'S TIME AND CONFIRMED BY A GRANT FROM QUEEN ELIZABETH THE FIRST.TWO OTHER FAIRS HELD IN APRIL AND NOVEMBER HAVE DWINDLED AWAY.IN LATER YEARS BARNET FAIR BECAME COCKNEY SLANG FOR 'HAIR'.
